weird_science.tablet.landing_text: §6§lWelcome to the Scientist's §6§lTablet!§r This acts as documentation guidebook for Weird Science.
weird_science.tablet.getting_started_des: Weird Science aims to add gadgets in a mad science style by utilizing fantasy style SciFi and a gadget building system.
weird_science.tablet.page1.values: Values are used to determine the properties of a component. In order for a gadget to work, the corresponding components must achieve values of a high enough degree. These values are §1Quanta§r, §2Flux§r, and §5Warp§r.
weird_science.tablet.page1.quanta: §1Quanta is a value that represents Positioning and Capacity.
weird_science.tablet.page2.quanta: Materials rich in Quanta include: Redstone, Prismarine, Aluminum, and Diamond.
weird_science.tablet.page1.flux: §2Flux is a value that represents Electricity and Magic.
weird_science.tablet.page2.flux: Materials rich in Flux include: Quartz, Blaze Powder, Copper, and Emerald.
weird_science.tablet.page1.warp: §5Warp is a value that represents Ender Tech and Bending Space.
weird_science.tablet.page2.warp: Materials rich in Warp include: Ender Pearls, Dragon's Breath, Gold, and Amethyst.
weird_science.tablet.page1.netherite: Netherite is a material that is rich in all three values, but is also very rare. It is found in the Nether, and can be used to create powerful gadgets.
weird_science.tablet.gadgets_and_modules: Gadgets and Modules are the main components of Weird Science and act as the backbone of a scientists future advancements.
weird_science.tablet.modules_desc: Modules are modifiers for the Player. They can be equipped in the Curios Inventory, and can be used to enhance the player's abilities.
weird_science.tablet.page1.tinkerers_len: The Tinkerer's Lens is a tool that, when equipped in the Curios Inventory, allows the player to see the information of a Component.
